intro: Lecanthus taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan lecanthus, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
